2082.subject: ISSM
2082.descrlong: The purpose of this course is to explore the dynamic historical relationships between cultures and their diverse impacts on the development of math, science, art, astronomy, literature, medicine, law, spirituality, and worldviews, in general.  Beginning with the Pre-Socratic philosophers, the history of scientific thought will be explored in this class with a particular emphasis on diverse contributions to the field of mathematics and science and their collective effects on the development of human knowledge.
